Prior Codifications

1981 Ed., ยง 11-942.

1973 Ed., ยง 11-942.

Editor's Notes

Throughout the section, "subpoena" and "subpoenas" were inserted, in brackets, to correct misspellings.

DC CODE ยง 11-942

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: The Superior Court may compel the attendance of witnesses by attachment. At the request of any party, subpenas [subpoenas] for attendance at a hearing or trial in the Superior Court shall be issued by the clerk of court. A subpena [subpoena] may be served at any place within the District of Columbia, or at any place without the District of Columbia that is within twenty-five miles of the place of the hearing or trial specified in the subpena [subpoena]. The form, issuance, and manner of service of the subpena [subpoena] shall be as prescribed by the rule of the court.
A subpena [subpoena] in a criminal case in which a felony is charged may be served at any place within the United States upon order of a judge of the court.

title.text: Organization and Jurisdiction of the Courts. (Refs & Annos)

chapter.text: Superior Court of the District of Columbia. (Refs & Annos)
